intro: Guapira witsbergeri, commonly known as the Witsberger’s guapira, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, typically blooming in spring. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Guapira witsbergeri is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
